item.title: Shared footpath / cyclepath covered in leaves, 3rd November
item.description:
There is an excess of wet and slippery leaves covering the path from Sainsburys up and on to the bridge over the dual carriageway. They are a potential slip hazard to both pedestrians and cyclists and they need clearing up properly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnett Way, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Balcarras road leaves and drains, 3rd November
item.description:
Good morning sorry to bother you but would it be possible to get the balcarras road swept and drains emptied as they are getting full of leaves and other debris and as this road suffers from flooding a bit of cleaning might help i know things are tight but i am willing to pay for this to be done if your not able to do so thank you for reading this regards Chris
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Balcarras, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Not taken a photo or stopped to measure these, the bag the other night as I drive along here tells me they are dangerous. People move to the centre of the road, it I can see was report d in February and nothing has been done. If these are not up to intervention level I would be very surprised., 2nd November
item.description:
You can't miss them if you use the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Coberley, Cotswold

item.title: Need a new bollard, 2nd November
item.description:
As reported previously, drivers are mounting the pavement every day and today a convoy of SUVs mounted the pavement and drove along it until they reached the next bollard (between Number4 and Number8). A bollard is needed between Number 2 (Old Dairy) and Number 4 for pedestrian safety.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Bollard cover is off and causing a trip hazard/obstruction (Non illuminating bollard or post)

item.title: Flooding, 2nd November
item.description:
Another drainage fault (like the one in Kimbrose Way ) the rain water collects both sides of the zebra crossing by Tesco,s on Cheltenham Road East Churchdown ,again poor work carried out by Cycle path contractors
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Slippery tops of cubes, 2nd November
item.description:
Top of cubes are very slippery when wet and a danger to kids using them to hop from one to the other. A number of kids have unfortunately been hurt by this hidden danger, please can it urgently be reviewed so further injuries don’t occur.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in front of houses, 2nd November
item.description:
There is a large pothole outside the property of 13/14 little Bayshill terrace. The street in dark in the evening and especially this time of the winter and this pothole cannot be seen making it dangerous. This has been here for a long time but keep twisting my ankle in it from not remembering it’s there when it’s dark. So can someone please come out and fill it in.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Little Bayshill Terrace, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous parking, 2nd November
item.description:
Vans are parking on both sides of the road here and creating a total bottle neck. Last week I was walking with my grandson on the pavement here and there was a very near miss when 2 cars travelling in opposite directions nearly collided when passing at the same time. The car skidded to a halt right next to my grandson!! The vans are there in morning and evening and its a matter of time until there is a bad crash. They take up almost an entire lane and theres no parking restrictions to keep this road safe. Please can someone investigate this before someone gets hurt. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 59, Court Road, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Failed repair once again due to inadequate excavation of poor substructure. Any repair will continue to fail until the substructure is properly addressed. Please don't waste yet more taxpayers money on an inadequate repair., 2nd November
item.description:
Adjacent to the junction of Kingscroft road with Porchester road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingscroft Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose drain cover, 2nd November
item.description:
This is a brand new drain cover put in on 21 October 25 when Cheltenham Surfacing had to dig up the new stretch of road to put it in on last night of road closure. It’s outside no 52 Cheltenham Road East. The drain makes considerable noise when traffic drives over or. Unacceptable for a brand new installation and nuisance to residents

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
